availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph H. Stackhouse (Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper collector and printer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, newspaper collector and printer. Pennsylvania native. Married to Mattie E. Lynn Stackhouse in Louisville, Kentucky, on October 18, 1855. Father of Willie Lynn Stackhouse, George E. Stackhouse, and Florence Stackhouse. Resident of Delaware County, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Collector for the Daily Courier in Louisville, Kentucky, from 1853 to 1855. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Hired one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Collector for the Louisville Daily Courier in Louisville in 1861. Publisher of the Morning Press in Louisville in 1863. Printer in partnership with Henry V. Escott in Escott, Stackhouse, & Company in Louisville in 1863 through 1865.
